resources.string:
Have you ever considered starting an exercise routine but then became overwhelmed by the sheer amount of information out there on the topic? We feel you, and that's why we decided to develop a solution designed to strip all the clutter and conflicting information out there and provide you with a personalized program based on your current situation and future goals. Our process is simple, and consists of the following three steps:

 1. Goal Discovery
 2. Profile Matching
 3. Program Creation

 And it is through these three steps that we aspire to build you a personalized exercise routine. Regardless of whether your goals are to build strength and muscle, flexilibity and endurance, or simply to become the greatest version of yourself, we are confident in our ability to provide you with the personalized roadmap to get there.
What is your target weight (in kg)?
How long do you want to work out for per session?
How many days per week do you want to work out?
What is your fitness level now (how often do you work out)?
What area do you want to work out?
Would you like to workout with or without weights?
Are you working out in a gym (with machines) or at home (without machines)?

Your answers indicate that, although you aspire to biuld muscle and strength, you are limited in the amount of time you can devote to exercise. As such, we believe that the following workout plan is best suited for your current situation

Full body split - 3 days a week

 Workout 1:

 Bench Press
 Pull ups
 Squats
 Shoulder Press
 Incline Dumbbell Curls
 Tricep Pulldown
 
 Workout 2:

 Deadlift
 Dips
 Bent Over Rows
 Dumbbell Lateral Raise
 Barbell Bicep Curl
 
 Workout 3:

 Squats
 Shoulder Press
 Pec Deck
 Dumbbell Rear Delt Fly
 Hammer Curls
 Skullcrushers

Your answers indicate that, although you are able to spend more time in the gym than some, yuour time is still limited to some degree. As such, the plan we believe would best fit your lifestyle is as follows:

Upper/Lower Split - 4 days a week

 Upper 1

 Bench Press
 Bent Over Row
 Shoulder Press
 Hercules Curl
 Dips
 
 Lower 1

 Leg extensions
 Straight Legged Deadlifts
 Hip Thrusts
 Calf Raises
 
 Upper 2

 Cable Crossovers
 Pull ups Arnold Press Hammer Curls Tricep Pulldown
 
 Lower 2

 Squats
 ` Bulgarian Split Squats
 Calf Raises
 Barbell Walking Lunges

Your answers indicate that you hope to gain as much strength and muscle as possible and that time is no issue. Given this, we believe that the following program will fit your lifestyle the best. It will have you in the gym 6 days a week with each muscle group being hit twice per week.

Chest/Tri's, Back/Bi's, Shoulders/Legs x2 per week

 Chest and Triceps 1 Bench Press
 Cable Crossovers
 Dumbbell Pullovers
 Tricep Pulldowns
 Skullcrushers
 Close grip bench press
 
 Back and Biceps 1

 Deadlifts
 Bent over rows
 Lat Pulldowm
 Hammer curls
 Preacher curls
 Hercules Curls
 
 Shoulder and Legs 1

 Squats
 Shoulder Press
 Bulgarian Split Squats
 Rear Delt Flies
 Arnold Press
 Leg Extensions
 Hamstring Curls
 
 Chest and Triceps 2

 Incline bench press
 Dumbbell flies
 Dips
 Tricep extension
 Diamond push ups
 Back and Biceps 2

 One arm dumbbell row
 Standing lat pull
 Inverted rows
 Dumbbell bicep curl with isometric hold
 Reverse grip bicep curl
 Chin up
 
 Shoulders and Legs 2

 Leg Press
 Hack Squat
 Hip Thrust
 Arnold Press
 Lateral Raise
 Face pull
